book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text:
In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Author's Introduction
Praise be to Allah, who clarified the path of truth for the seeker, uncovered the darkness of falsehood for the student, improved the merchandise for the importer, broke the tyrants and overpowered them. No one draws near to Him except that he returns with gains, and no one distances himself from Him except that he returns with calamities. He rose over His Throne as He said, not as the people of calamities say, and He is elevated above His heavens, so oh the happiness of the one who returns. «And our Lord, Blessed and Exalted is He, descends every night to the lowest heaven and asks: Is there anyone seeking forgiveness? Is there anyone repenting?» So stand and ask for your needs, for the door has no doorkeeper.

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text:
And I bear witness that there is no deity but Allah alone, with no partner, no opposite, no peer, no likeness, and no approximation. And I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant, His messenger, His beloved, and His close friend; may Allah bless him, his family, and his companions and grant them abundant peace whenever the clouds rain.
To proceed:
This is a book clarifying the triple divorce, its ruling, and the difference of people regarding it. I named it: The Book of «The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce» (Sayr al-Hath ila 'Ilm al-Talaq al-Thalath). I ask Allah for assistance, and that He makes it sincere for His Noble Face, and He is sufficient for us and the best Disposer of affairs. I have made it into twelve chapters:
Chapter One: That the triple divorce occurs as three.
Chapter Two: Regarding who held this view and gave fatwa by it.
Chapter Three: Mentioning what this group used as evidence.
Chapter Four: That it only occurs as one by the three [pronouncements].
Chapter Five: Regarding who held this view and gave fatwa by it.
Chapter Six: Mentioning what this group used as evidence.
Chapter Seven: Mentioning the point of dispute between the two parties.
Chapter Eight: Mentioning the schools of thought of people regarding that.
Chapter Nine: Mentioning the three [divorces] if they come separately.

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce

Chapter Eleven: Mentioning the Muhallil (legalizer) and his rulings.

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text:
Chapter One
That the Triple Divorce Occurs as Three
This is the correct view of the Madhhab, and she does not become lawful for him until she marries a husband other than him; as will come. This opinion is asserted firmly in most books of the companions of Imam Ahmad; such as «Al-Khiraqi», «Al-Muqni», «Al-Muharrar», «Al-Hidayah», and others from the books of the companions of Imam Ahmad, and one does not deviate from it. Al-Athram said: (I asked Abu .. .. ..

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: Abdullah about the Hadith of Ibn Abbas «Divorce during the time of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, Abu Bakr, and [two years of the caliphate of] Umar, was that [triple divorce] was one», with what do you repel it? He said: With the narration of the people from Ibn Abbas that it is three). It was prioritized in «Al-Furu'», and asserted in «Al-Mughni», and most of them did not narrate other than it. And Allah knows best the truth.

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text:
Chapter Two
Regarding Who Held This View and Gave Fatwa By It
Ibn Abbas held this view more than once, as well as Ibn Umar, Abdullah bin Amr, Uthman, Ali, Ibn Masud, and Anas. It was mentioned in «Al-Mughni»,

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: and he said: «It is the saying of the majority of the people of knowledge», and Ahmad said it, as well as Al-Shafi'i, Abu Hanifa, Malik, Ibn Abi Layla, and Al-Awza'i. And from our companions, Al-Khiraqi, The Judge (Al-Qadi), Abu Bakr, Ibn Hamid, Ibn .. .. ..

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: Aqil, Abu Al-Khattab, Al-Shirazi, Sheikh Muwaffaq al-Din, and Sheikh Majd al-Din —though not absolutely as will come—, and Al-Sharif. Indeed, most of the companions of Imam Ahmad are on this view. And in the «Ijma'» (Consensus) of Ibn al-Mundhir there is what indicates that it is a consensus, though not explicit in it. This view was chosen by Ibn Rajab, and he authored a refutation against those who held the contrary view. And Allah knows best the truth.

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text:
Chapter Three
Mentioning What This Group Used as Evidence, and What is For Them and Against Them
He said in «I'lam al-Muwaqqi'in» —after mentioning the evidence of the first group— then he said: (However, the Commander of the Faithful, Umar, saw that people had taken the matter of divorce lightly, and its occurrence from them all at once had increased. So he saw that it was in the interest to punish them by enforcing it upon them; so that they would know that if one of them enacted it all at once, the woman would be irrevocably divorced (Ba'in), and she would be forbidden to him until she marries a husband other than him in a marriage of desire, intended for permanence, not a marriage of legalization (Tahlil); for he was among the strictest of people regarding that. So if they knew that, they would refrain from [forbidden] divorce. So Umar saw that this was a benefit (Maslahah) for them in his time, and he saw that what was present during the time of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and the time of Al-Siddiq and the beginning of his own caliphate was not suitable for them; because they did not

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: persist in it, and they used to fear Allah regarding divorce, and Allah has made a way out for everyone who fears Him. But when they abandoned the fear of Allah, and played with the Book of Allah, and divorced in a manner other than what Allah legislated, he bound them to what they bound themselves to; as a punishment for them. For Allah only legislated divorce time after time, and did not legislate it all at once. So whoever combined the three in one time has transgressed the limits of Allah, wronged himself, and played with the Book of Allah, so he deserves to be punished and bound to what he committed himself to, and not to be affirmed upon Allah's license and latitude, when he has made it difficult for himself, and did not fear Allah and divorce as Allah commanded him and legislated for him. Rather, he hastened what Allah had granted him a delay in, as a mercy from Him and kindness, but he was not [kind] to himself, and chose the roughest and severest. And this is a rule, which is: «Whoever hastens something before its time, is punished by being deprived of it». This is from the good policy of Umar and his disciplining of his subjects. The Companions agreed with him on what he enforced, and they declared that to those who asked them for fatwa. Abdullah bin Masud said: «Whoever approaches the matter as it should be, Allah clarifies

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: [it for him], and whoever confuses himself, We place his confusion upon him. By Allah, you do not confuse yourselves except that we will make you bear it. It is as you say». And the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to the one who did that: «Is the Book of Allah being played with while I am among you?» until a man stood up and said: O Messenger of Allah! Shall I kill him?. And when Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr hesitated in enforcing it, he said to the questioner: «This is a matter in which we have no say, so go to Abdullah bin Abbas and Abu Hurairah. When he went to them, Ibn Abbas said to Abu Hurairah: Give him a fatwa; for a dilemma has come to you», then they gave him a fatwa that it occurs.

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: So the Companions, may Allah be pleased with them, and at their forefront Umar bin Al-Khattab, when they saw that people had taken the matter of divorce lightly, and released what was in their hands of it, and confused themselves, and did not fear Allah in the divorce which He legislated for them, they took to being strict on themselves, and did not stop at what was limited for them. They [the Companions] bound them to what they bound themselves to, and enforced upon them what they chose for themselves of strictness, whereas Allah had expanded for them what He legislated for them to the contrary. And there is no doubt that whoever does this deserves punishment, by having enforced upon him what he enforced upon himself, having not accepted Allah's license, ease, and respite. For this reason, Ibn Abbas said to the one who divorced a hundred times: «You disobeyed your Lord, and your wife has become irrevocably separated from you. You did not fear Allah so that He would make a way out for you. {And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him a way out}». And a man came to him and said: My uncle divorced three times. He said: «Your uncle disobeyed Allah, so Allah made him regretful, and he obeyed Satan, so He did not make a way out for him. He said: Will you not make her lawful for him? He said: Whoever deceives Allah, Allah deceives him». And Sa'id bin Jubayr said: «A man came to Ibn Abbas and said: I divorced

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: my wife a thousand times. He said: As for three, your wife is forbidden to you, and the rest are a burden (sin); you have taken the signs of Allah in jest». Mujahid said: «I was with Ibn Abbas, and a man came to him and said: He divorced his wife three times. He remained silent until I thought he was going to return her to him. Then he said: One of you goes and rides foolishness, then says: O Ibn Abbas! While Allah has said: {And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him a way out}; and indeed you did not fear Allah, so I did not find a way out for you. You disobeyed your Lord, so your wife is irrevocably separated from you». Let the scholar whose intent is knowing the truth and following it reflect upon the legislation and destiny in

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: the acceptance of the Companions of this license and ease during the time of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and their fearing of their Lord, Blessed and Exalted is He, in divorce. So His license and ease flowed upon them legislatively and destinedly. But when people committed foolishness, abandoned the fear of Allah, confused themselves, and divorced in a manner other than what Allah legislated for them, Allah the Wise executed through the tongue of the Righteous Caliph, and the Companions with him, a legislation, and He bound them to that, enforcing it upon them, and keeping the burden which they placed around their own necks. These are secrets from the secrets of the Legislation (Shar') and Destiny (Qadar) that do not suit the minds of the people of the time. So the Imams of Islam came following the traces of the Companions, treading their path, seeking the pleasure of Allah and His Messenger, and enforcing His religion. Among them are those who abandoned the saying of the Hadith of Ibn Abbas, thinking it to be abrogated, and this is the method of Al-Shafi'i). Sheikh Muwaffaq al-Din said in «Al-Mughni» something similar to this, and used as evidence what was narrated from Ubada bin al-Samit, who said: («One of my fathers divorced his wife a thousand times. So he went to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and they said: O Messenger of Allah! Our father divorced our mother a thousand times, does he have a way out? He said: Your father did not fear Allah so that He would make for him a way out of his affair. She is irrevocably separated from him

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: by three contrary to the Sunnah, and nine hundred and ninety-seven are a sin on his neck»; and because marriage is ownership that can be removed separately, so it can be validly removed collectively like other ownerships. As for the Hadith of Ibn Abbas, the narration has been authenticated from him to the contrary, and he also gave fatwa to the contrary. Al-Athram said: «I asked Abu Abdullah about the Hadith of Ibn Abbas: With what do you repel it? He said: I repel it with the narration of the people from Ibn Abbas from various perspectives that it is three». It was said: «The meaning of the Hadith of Ibn Abbas is that people used to divorce once during the time of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and Abu Bakr, so it is not permissible that Umar opposes what was in the time of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and Abu Bakr, nor is it acceptable for Ibn Abbas to narrate this from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and give fatwa to the contrary). Ibn Rajab said in the book «Mushkil al-Ahadith al-Waridah fi anna al-Talaq al-Thalath Wahidah» (Problematic Hadiths Reported Regarding Triple Divorce Being One): (The First Hadith: The Hadith of Tawus from Ibn Abbas who said: «Divorce during

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: the time of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, Abu Bakr, and two years of the caliphate of Umar: triple divorce was one. So Umar bin Al-Khattab said: The people have hastened in a matter in which they had delay, so what if we enforced it upon them? So he enforced it upon them», and he also narrated it via the path of Ibrahim bin Maysarah from Tawus, similarly). The Imams of Islam have two paths regarding this Hadith: The First: Which is the path of Imam Ahmad and those who agreed with him, and it returns to discussing the chain (Isnad) of the Hadith regarding its anomaly (Shudhudh), and Tawus being solitary in narrating it, and that he was not corroborated in it. The solitariness of a narrator with a Hadith, even if he is trustworthy (Thiqah), is a defect (Illah) in the Hadith that necessitates pausing regarding it, and that it be considered anomalous (Shadh) and objectionable (Munkar) if its meaning is not narrated from a valid perspective. This is the method of the early Imams of Hadith; like Imam Ahmad, Yahya al-Qattan, Yahya bin Ma'in, Ali bin al-Madini, and others. And this Hadith is not narrated from Ibn Abbas by anyone other than Tawus.

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: Imam Ahmad said in the narration of Ibn Mansour: «All of the companions of Ibn Abbas —meaning: narrated from him— contrary to what Tawus narrated». Al-Rushna'i said: «It is an anomalous (Shadh) Hadith. He said: And I have been concerned with this Hadith since old times, and I did not find a basis for it». The Author said: «And when the Ummah agrees on discarding the practice of a Hadith, it becomes obligatory to discard it and abandon acting upon it». Ibn Mahdi said: «One who acts upon the anomalous (Shadh) cannot be a leader (Imam) in knowledge».

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: Al-Nakh'i said: «They used to dislike the strange (Gharib) from Hadith». Yazid bin Abi Habib said: «If you hear a Hadith, seek it as you seek a lost animal; if it is recognized [by others], otherwise leave it». From Malik, he said: «The worst of knowledge is the strange, and the best of knowledge is the apparent which the people have narrated». In this chapter there is much, due to the impermissibility of acting upon the strange and un-famous. Ibn Rajab said: «It has been authenticated from Ibn Abbas —who is the narrator of the Hadith— that he gave fatwa contrary to this Hadith, and the binding of the three collectively. Ahmad and Al-Shafi'i used this as a defect [justification to reject] as mentioned in «Al-Mughni», and this is also a defect in the Hadith by itself, so how about when the defect of anomaly, objectionability, and the consensus of the Ummah is added to it?!». Judge Isma'il said in the book «Ahkam al-Quran»: «Tawus, despite his virtue and righteousness, narrates objectionable things, including this Hadith».

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: From Ayyub: «That he used to wonder at the abundance of Tawus's errors». Ibn Abd al-Barr said: «Tawus was anomalous in this Hadith». Ibn Rajab said: «The scholars of the people of Mecca used to disapprove of Tawus for the anomalous sayings he was solitary in». The Second Path: Which is the path of Ibn Rahwaih and those who followed him, which is discussing the meaning of the Hadith, which is that it should be interpreted as applying to the one with whom marriage has not been consummated (Ghayr Madkhul Biha). Ibn Mansour reported this from Ishaq, and Ishaq pointed to it in the book «Al-Jami'», and Abu Bakr Al-Athram titled a chapter on it in his «Sunan», and Abu Bakr Al-Khallal indicates it. And in «Sunan Abi Dawood» from the narration of Hammad bin Zaid from Ayyub, from more than

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: one, from Tawus: That a man called Abu al-Sahba used to ask Ibn Abbas frequently, he said: «If a man divorced his wife three times before entering upon her (consummation), they used to make it one during the time of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and Abu Bakr, and the beginning of the emirate of Umar. But when he saw people persisting in it, he said: Enforce them upon them. And Ayyub is a great Imam. If it is said: But the narration is absolute (unrestricted), We say: Combining the two evidences, and we say: This is before consummation. Ibn Rajab said: (The Second Hadith: «Abd al-Razzaq narrated from Ibn Jurayj: Some of the sons of Abu Rafi', the freed slave of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, informed me from Ikrimah, the freed slave of Ibn Abbas, from Ibn Abbas who said: Abd Yazid Abu Rukanah and his brothers divorced Umm Rukanah, and he married a woman from Muzaynah. She came to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and said: He is of no avail to me except as this hair is of avail —referring to a hair she took from her head— so separate between me and him. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, became zealous, called for Rukanah and his brothers, then said to those sitting with him: Do you see

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: such and such resemblance in so and so? They said: Yes. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to Abd Yazid: Divorce her. So he did. He said: Take back your wife, Umm Rukanah and his brothers. He said: I divorced her three times, O Messenger of Allah. He said: I know, take her back. And he recited: {O Prophet, when you divorce women, divorce them for their waiting period}. Narrated by Abu Dawood). He said: (Discussion on this Hadith is from several aspects: First: Its chain is unknown (Majhul). Second: The man who was not named in the narration of Abd al-Razzaq is Muhammad bin Ubaydullah bin Abi Rafi', and he is a man weak in Hadith by agreement, and his Hadiths are objectionable (Munkar), and it was said: He is abandoned (Matruk), so this Hadith falls based on that. Third: It is Muhammad bin Thawr al-Saghani: A great trustworthy worshiper, and Muhammad bin Thawr did not mention in his narration that he divorced her three times, but rather said: «I divorced her», and Abd al-Razzaq narrated in the end of his life very objectionable [Hadiths] regarding the virtues of Ahl al-Bayt and dispraising others, and he had an inclination towards Shi'ism, and this ruling is what agrees with the desire of the Shia. Fourth: That the Hadith of Abd al-Razzaq, even if its text were authentic, does not contain that he divorced her three times

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: with one word, so it can be interpreted that he divorced three times in multiple instances, but this incident was before limiting the number of divorces to three. Fifth: That Abu Dawood opposed the Hadith of Abd al-Razzaq with what the son of Rukanah narrated from him: «That he divorced his wife absolutely (Al-Battah)» he said: «And it is more authentic than the Hadith of the father of Abu Rafi'»). Then Ibn Rajab said in this book: «Chapter: Know that nothing explicit has been established from any of the Companions, nor the Followers, nor the Imams of the Predecessors whose words are counted in Fatwas regarding the Halal and Haram, that the triple divorce after consummation counts as one, if it is delivered with one wording. From Al-A'mash, he said: «There was a Sheikh in Kufa who used to say: I heard Ali bin Abi Talib say: If a man divorces his wife three times in one sitting, she is returned to one. And the people were all rushing to that, coming to him and listening from him. So I came to him and said: You heard Ali bin Abi Talib say? He said: I heard him say: If a man divorces

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: his wife three times in one sitting, she is returned to one. I said: Where did you hear this from Ali? He said: I will bring out my book for you. So he brought out his book, and therein was: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. This is what I heard Ali ibn Abi Talib say: If a man divorces his wife three times in one sitting, she is irrevocably separated from him, and she is not lawful for him until she marries a husband other than him. I said: Woe to you! This is other than what you say. He said: The correct one is this, but these people wanted me to do that». And from Ibrahim bin Abd al-A'la from Suwayd bin Ghaflah said: «Aisha bint al-Fadl was with Al-Hasan bin Ali. When pledge of allegiance was given to him for the Caliphate, she congratulated him. He said: Do you show gloating at the killing of the Commander of the Faithful? You are divorced three times. And he gave her a gift of ten thousand. Then he said: Were it not that I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, my grandfather —or I heard my father narrate from my grandfather peace and blessings be upon him— saying: If a man divorces his wife three times at the [times of] purity, or divorces her three times vaguely, she is not lawful for him until she marries a husband other than him, I would have taken her back».

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: Ibn Rajab said: «And its chain is authentic». Then Ibn Rajab said after this: (Chapter: It has been inferred that the combined three occur by multiple evidences from the Book and the Sunnah. As for the Book, there are places: First: His saying: {O Prophet, when you divorce women, divorce them for their waiting period}. Up to His saying: {And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him a way out}. Ibn Abbas deduced from His saying: {And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him a way out} that whoever divorces according to what Allah commanded for the commencement of the waiting period as a revocable divorce and leaves her until her waiting period expires, or takes her back, Allah has made a way out for him, either by taking her back during the waiting period, or marrying her after it without a [intervening] husband or intercourse. But whoever divorces contrary to what Allah commanded, and divorces three times, Allah has not made a relief or a way out for him. This is established from Ibn Abbas. The Second Place: His saying in the context of verses: {And do not take the verses of Allah in jest}. Al-Hasan said: «A man in the time of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to divorce and say: I was playing, and free a slave and say: I was playing, and marry off his son and say: I was playing. So the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Three, whoever says them playing, they are binding upon them: Manumission, Divorce, and Marriage. So Allah Almighty revealed: {And do not take the verses of Allah in jest}.

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: The Third Place: He said: And it is what appears to me, praise be to Allah, from the verse that the one who divorced twice is commanded to keep with fairness, or release with kindness. So the verse indicates that the one who divorced twice is commanded to keep with fairness, which is taking back (Raj'ah) by the agreement of the exegetes, or release with kindness. Scholars differed regarding the meaning of kindness (Ihsan). A group said: It is the third divorce, which is the saying of Mujahid, Qatadah, and others, and Abu Bakr Abd al-Aziz bin Ja'far from our companions chose it. The second saying in the verse: That the meaning of releasing with kindness: clearing her path until her waiting period expires, so he leaves the way open between her and husbands). Ibn Rajab placed at the end of this book of his [a section] on Umar originating the divorce [ruling], and that his saying is accepted. He said: (Chapter: Al-Bukhari narrated via the path of Abu Salamah, from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, who said: «Indeed, there were among the nations before you

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text: people who were spoken to (Muhaddathun/inspired). If there is anyone in my Ummah, it is Umar». And in a narration he mentioned as Mu'allaq (suspended): That the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «Indeed, there were among those [who were] before you from the Children of Israel men who spoke without being prophets. If there is anyone among them [my Ummah], it is Umar», Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, said: [Clarifying the verse] Neither a prophet nor a Muhaddath». Muslim narrated from the Hadith of Abu Salamah, from Aisha, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, who said: «There used to be in the nations [before you] Muhaddathun. If there is anyone in my Ummah, it is Umar bin Al-Khattab». According to him: Ibn Wahb said: «Explanation of Muhaddathun: Inspired (Mulhamun)». Al-Tirmidhi said from Sufyan bin Uyaynah who said: «Meaning made to understand (Mufahhamun)».

book_title: The Urger's Journey to the Knowledge of the Triple Divorce
text:
And from Abu Sa'id from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, adding in it: «They said: O Messenger of Allah! How is he spoken to? He said: The angels speak upon his tongue»). And Allah knows best.
